meanings.definition: To adjust or change the gearing of something, such as a vehicle or machine, to operate more efficiently.
meanings.sent1: He regeared his bicycle to pedal faster on the uphill road.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic regeared the car for better fuel efficiency.
meanings.sent3: She regeared the clock to make time go backwards - just for fun!
meanings.sent4: The team regeared their strategy to navigate through the tough competition.
meanings.sent5: The student regeared his study schedule to ace the upcoming exam.

meanings.definition: To reorganize or rearrange something in order to achieve a different outcome or result.
meanings.sent1: The company regeared its marketing campaign to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: She regeared her daily routine to have more time for hobbies.
meanings.sent3: He regeared the furniture layout to confuse his mischievous cat.
meanings.sent4: The teacher regeared the lesson plan to engage the students better.
meanings.sent5: The chef regeared the recipe to make it healthier without losing flavor.
